alert.note: Alert for Maricopa (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 26 at 9:53PM MST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 AM MST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of south central and southeast Arizona, including the following counties, in south central Arizona, Maricopa. In southeast Arizona, Pinal. * WHEN...Until 100 AM MST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 953 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Up to 1.25 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Mesa, Apache Junction, Florence, Gold Canyon, Queen Creek, Florence Junction, Magma, Queen Valley, Gold Camp, San Tan Valley, Kings Ranch, Superstition Mountains, Blackwater and Valley Farms. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
